definition: to tilt one's head back to see (sth)/to look up at
surname Yang
to face upward/to look up/to admire/to rely on
to look at/to regard/to inspect

sentences.english: She smiled impishly and didn't look up.
He gazed straight up into the gray sky and knew that he was hungry.
sentences.chinese: 他仰視着灰色的天空，知道肚子餓了。

sentences.english: It is better to be looked over than overlooked.
sentences.chinese: 被人仰視總比被人看不起要強的多。

sentences.english: We gazed up at the cloudless blue sky, marvelling in the magnificence and beauty of it all.
sentences.chinese: 仰視藍天，萬里無雲，恢宏的美景讓我們慨嘆萬千。

sentences.english: If you look up at the next Full Moon, you can see her face for yourself.
sentences.chinese: 如果你仰視下一次的滿月，你自己便可看見她的臉蛋。

definition: to overlook/to look down at
to bend/to curve around/curved/crooked/to wind/to warp
to belittle/to disparage/to play down/to demean/to degrade/to devalue
to express/to exhibit
to bow the head/to yield/to give in
difference/peculiar
to hang in the air/suspended in midair/(fig.) uncertain
to contempt/to disdain/pejorative
to take pity on/pity/mercy
to stoop
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to peep at/to spy on/to peek
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
aloof/indifferent/unconcerned
petite/delicate/dainty
to gaze at/to fix one's eyes on
